reviewText:
Product received for free

Please NOTE:I did receive the game by the Developer..
Great arcade stylish game! All you do is hold on the fire button, move around, and jump on the blue disk for multipliers which will also let you absorbed bullets for a small amount of time. Enjoyed the boss fights. Boss fights you can fight him straight on or hit the blue disk trying to get extra damage on him. Soundtrack actually goes really well with the game. After the 9th wave the game becomes a huge cluster mess!!

Pros
-Boss battles
-6 game modes to play (2 are locked)
-Change effects (dynamic, scanlines, Crt, Inverse, overglow, and None
-Change game speed &  auto fire
-Colorful
-Game over, you can restart game or restart last checkpoint
-Ingame scores to challenge friends and family to beat your high score

Cons
No coop or local coop
No steam leaderboarder

reviewText: A shmup with a twist: shoot the reds and avoid their fire as you try to bounce off the blues to gain a shield and rack up bonuses. And don't forget  to destroy the greens for extra points while you're at it. Yes, it does get a wee bit hectic. All in glorious 80s inspired neon and laser art.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Hello everybody, Shaun Meyers here from Universal Gaming Reviews to bring you a short summary/review for Hyper Bounce Blast by Flump Studios.

If you'd like to read our full review, you can find it here: https://www.universalgamingreviews.com/hyper-bounce-blast-overview-and-review/

Hyper Bounce Blast is a unique combination of a bullet hell shoot 'em up game and a 2D platformer. You control a circular \ship" as you defeat red enemies and bounce on blue ones.

The game has a wide range of different game modes to choose from including Arcade Classic
date: Time Rush and Tournament mode with 2 secret
recommended: unlockable modes that are just too hot to handle!\n\nThere\'s also a lot of customization options you can mess with like game speed (Up to 200%) and various visual effects like pixelate or inverse (Inverse will set your cornias on fire
hoursPlayed:
you have been warned).

The game is definitely Flump Studios' best release to date and they've improved on their shoot em up formula quite a bit with Hyper Bounce Blast as well and it's great to finally have seen the final product as well.

We gave Hyper Bounce Blast 4.2 stars out of 5 in our full review and we're going to be giving the game our recommendation here on Steam as well. Defijnitely worth checking out if you're a fan of bullet hell games.

We've also recorded a gameplay video which you can find below
voteText: happy gaming!\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=weTfbhqOffE"

reviewText:
Product received for free

Flump Studios is back at it with their next shmup and it is a blast! I played and enjoyed Horizon Shift, but this game goes above and beyond what Horizon Shift did in terms of fun.

Gameplay is pretty simple. You bounce around on blue enemies, absorbing bullets when you are hopping around, and shoot the red enemies. Of course there a boss battles and bonus stages to play as well. When you pair the awesome, varied gameplay and a great soundtrack, you have a great game.

1/1 good game
voteText: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Hyper Bounce Blast is a sort of follow up to Horizon Shift, as in it's an another game that puts an another new twist on the classic arcade shooter genre. Now Horizon Shift was a cool game however I felt confused by it's mechanics at times (probably my own fault because i'm not that used to crazy mechanics) however this game is a completely different story.

HBB's main mechanic is as expected, bouncing! You bounce off blue platforms and enemies and while you are in the air bouncing, you cannot be killed and the higher you bounce, the more points you will get when shooting enemies.

So it becomes an interesting game of multitasking because you have to maintain your bouncing while also dealing with enemies and obstacles that appear in later waves and frankly? It never gets TOO HARD, it's always fair, so when I mess up it is my fault because I wasn't paying attention because everything in this game is telegraphed very well in advance.

Also the bosses definitely not dissapoint and make full use of the mechanics, so expect hectic platforming shooting action on those!

Overall, I highly recommend this game for everyone, even those who do not play these games. PS. Try to get 5 stars so you can witness the amazing tribute to a classic ;)

reviewText:
Another sterling effort from Flump Studios. As an old-school gamer, I alwys value playability over any kind of story.

This title, much like the previously released Horizon Shift, epitomises how a progressive, balanced and well implemented set of gameplay mechanics can take a genre like the humble shmup and bring it bang up to date.

After 5 waves, i was interested... After 10 waves, i was hooked! Invest your time into learning the stages and see your scores increase almost exponentially. Soon you'll be bouncing and blasting your way around the screen with reckless abandon. And your reward for mastering these mechanics...? You can play them again, with MUCH harder settings!

If you consider yourself a lover of games, you really should own this one. Sublime work!

reviewText:
Product received for free

This game is a very creative take on a shmup with platforming elements. Shoot the reds, bounce on the blues. Kill all of the few green enemies in each wave to reach a very fun bonus round. Gameplay is simple and easy to start, but difficult to master with so much going on! I was immediately reminded of Geometry Wars not only by the visual style but also by the mess of things happening all at once. Fortunately, in this game you are completely invulnerable to enemy attacks as long as you stay airborne by bouncing off the blue enemies. As an added bonus, when bouncing, you actually absorb enemy fire to power up your screen-obliterating special attack! Despite the invulnerability, it can still be quite challenging as blue enemies aren't always spaced out evenly. If you aren't keeping the reds and their projectiles thinned out, hitting the ground can spell the instant loss of a life. Boss battles limit your bouncing and provide a bit more of a bullet hell experience, but are not too challenging and very fair once you learn their patterns.

All in all, Hyper Bounce Blast is a lot of fun and can be very addicting. I definitely recommend it!

reviewText:
Product received for free

The developer asked me to test the controls for this game to see if everything felt normal, I'm glad to say that the controls are fine and have no issue to them, and even if you don't like them you can always change them in the main menu. I would also like to mention that the developer is a cool person and is willing to talk to customers about problems they have with their product.

Here is my honest review, this review reflects my feelings towards this game and it's soundtrack.

The game is just pure fun. To go into more detail the game has unique concepts that blend well when you are playing the game. The platforming feels great, satisfyang, and responsive, which leads to some satisfyiong jump combos. The shooting also does it's job just fine. I use mouse and keyboard instead of controller, but I can only imagine that controllers are better than the M+K setup. The game is in all honesty just pure fun, I genuinely can't think of any cons at the moment; not to say that there aren't any cons, but none of any significance.

I'm glad to say that the soundtrack is just as awesome as the game itself. The soundtrack not only sounds great, but also matches the game through the type of rythm's. During the waves of enemies the soundtrack is energetic, but before a boss it switches to give you a sense of approaching danger, then it goes to a new song that is different then the ones played during the waves.

All in all I couldn't recommend this game enough, espescially since the asking price is only 5$. I would also recommend everyone to check out other flump studio games, they are all fun.
